heisig_chinese_memo: Vampire orders blood in one of those posh restaurants. Imagine his shock when all he gets is a giant white dish and just a single drop of blood in the centre and a drizzling of balsamic around the edge. Disgusted he calls the manager over tells him its overpriced tosh and bites into his neck with a huge gush of blood spraying everywhere.
heisig_story: The drop in the dish is blood. It is similar to the drop we saw earlier on the dagger in the character for blade (Frame 88).

WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The blood radical and blood are the same in looks as well as in meaning.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: There'll be some bad blood between us if you're not studying your radicals, especially when they're the same like this kanji!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic:
To remember the reading „Åë„Å§, we use the word "ketsup." The perfect mix of ketchup and catsup!
The radical is technically blood, but you know that radical is just a drop (of blood) on a plate. So, you ask yourself... Is that really blood on the plate? Could it be? You decide to take a gamble and lick it off. When you taste it, it's definitely not blood. No, it's ketsup („Åë„Å§).
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Feel the relief that you didn't just lick up someone's blood. Taste the ketsup taste, too. It's pretty good. Not quite ketchup, but not quite catsup. Yum!

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Vampire orders blood in one of those posh restaurants. Imagine his shock when all he gets is a giant white dish and just a single drop of blood in the centre and a drizzling of balsamic around the edge. Disgusted he calls the manager over tells him its overpriced tosh and bites into his neck with a huge gush of blood spraying everywhere.
origin_of_ch_char_book: The kings of ancient East Asia would hold a ceremony when they met for treaties. They would fill the ceremonial cauldron with the blood of the sacrificed animal. Afterwards, they would drink the blood or smear the blood over their lips. (Ë°Ä, xie=hsieh, blood) In this character, we can see a ceremonial cauldron and a spot . This spot symbolizes the ceremonial meat or ceremonial blood. Lieges are bowing down on their knees at the same time in the royal court. < Lee Royal Family Association, Korea >
humanum_full_description_en:
Hieroglyphic characters, starting from " dish ", with a circle or a little bit like blood in the middle. The original meaning is the blood of the livestock sacrificed to the gods (Xu Shen).

The words " blood " and " meng " in the oracle bone inscriptions are similar, but the things on the " dish " are different. The only two characters are often used interchangeably in the inscriptions, see " meng ". The characters of the Warring States Period are derived from the oracle bone inscriptions, and the characters are written from the " pan ". "Said the text": "Blood, the blood of the sacrifice recommended. From the dish, it looks like blood. All blood belongs to the blood."

The word " blood " in the oracle bone inscription refers to killing animals to take blood to sacrifice to ancestors, as in "Collection" 22231: "Three sheep in blood." It refers to taking three sheep as blood sacrifice. In addition, the word "blood chamber" is commonly used in Oracle bone inscriptions, which is the name of the ancestral temple. "Compilation" 41091: "Only (in) the blood chamber." Also in Oracle bone inscriptions, "blood son" is the object of sacrifice. " Blood " can also be used as a place name.

" Blood " in the bronze inscription is pronounced " shirt ", Chen Niyan: "Huanxue clan", pressing " huan " and " shirt " has the meaning of worry, the whole sentence refers to worry clan family.
humanum_short_description_en: " Blood " is like blood in a vessel.

Hieroglyphic characters, starting from " dish", with a circle or a little bit like blood in the middle. The original meaning is the blood of the livestock sacrificed to the gods (Xu Shen). The words " blood" and " meng" in the oracle bone inscriptions are similar, but the things on the " dish" are different. The only two characters are often used interchangeably in the inscriptions, see " meng". The characters of the Warring States Period are derived from the oracle bone inscriptions, and the characters are written from the " pan". "Said the text": "Blood, the blood of the sacrifice recommended. From the dish, it looks like blood. All blood belongs to the blood." The word " blood" in the oracle bone inscription refers to killing animals to take blood to sacrifice to ancestors, as in "Collection" 22231: "Three sheep in blood." It refers to taking three sheep as blood sacrifice. In addition, the word "blood chamber" is commonly used in Oracle bone inscriptions, which is the name of the ancestral temple. "Compilation" 41091: "Only (in) the blood chamber." Also in Oracle bone inscriptions, "blood son" is the object of sacrifice. " Blood" can also be used as a place name. " Blood" in the bronze inscription is pronounced " shirt", Chen Niyan: "Huanxue clan", pressing " huan" and " shirt" has the meaning of worry, the whole sentence refers to worry clan family.

blood
Basic explanation of words
blood
xu√®
Most of the opaque liquid in the circulatory system of humans or animals is red, and the main components are "plasma", "blood cells" and "platelets". Salty and fishy: blood type. Blood lipids. blood pressure. blood sugar. Blood stains. Blood and sweat. Blood and tears. Bloodbath. Blood book. Bloody wind. A bloody hatred.
The relationship formed naturally by human beings due to fertility: blood lineage. Blood relationship.
Yu Gangqiang warmly: bloody. The blood is just right.
blood
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[‚ë†]Ôºªxu√®ÔºΩÔºªxiƒõÔºΩ
["Guangyun" call for a decisive cut, into the crumbs, Xiao. ]
(1) In ancient times, it specifically refers to animal blood used as a sacrifice. Later also refers to blood.
(2) Refers to tears shed because of grief.
(3) Refers to close relatives who are related by blood.
(4) Refers to blood relationship, blood lineage.
(5) Refers to blood red.
(6) Kill; hurt.
(7) It is said that blood is smeared.
(8) Dyeing.
(9) Metaphor is strong and enthusiastic.
(10) Refers to menstruation.
(11) Through "shirts". Worry; worry.

blood
Source glyph
blood
Name meaning
blood. The fluid in the heart and blood vessels of humans and animals is composed of blood cells, platelets and plasma. It circulates around the body, delivers nutrients and hormones to various tissues, and collects waste to the excretory organs. And it has the functions of resisting germs and regulating body temperature.

Radicals: Ë°Ä  (blood)
Meaning Mnemonic
The blood radical and blood are the same in looks as well as in meaning.
There'll be some bad blood between us if you're not studying your radicals, especially when they're the same like this kanji!
Reading Mnemonic
To remember the reading „Åë„Å§, we use the word "ketsup." The perfect mix of ketchup and catsup!
The radical is technically blood, but you know that radical is just a drop (of blood) on a plate. So, you ask yourself... Is that really blood on the plate? Could it be? You decide to take a gamble and lick it off. When you taste it, it's definitely not blood. No, it's ketsup („Åë„Å§).
Feel the relief that you didn't just lick up someone's blood. Taste the ketsup taste, too. It's pretty good. Not quite ketchup, but not quite catsup. Yum!
